item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Bill Keane
item.description: "Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present." -- Bill Keane

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Henri Nouwen
item.description: "When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives mean the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand. The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing, not curing, not healing and face with us the reality of our powerlessness, that is a friend who cares." -- Henri Nouwen

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Max Lucado
item.description: "Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right." -- Max Lucado

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Max Lucado
item.description: "You are the only you God made... God made you and broke the mold." -- Max Lucado

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description:
"Atticus, he was real nice."
"Most people are, Scout, when you finally see them." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Max Lucado
item.description: "Forgive and give as if it were your last opportunity. Love like there's no tomorrow, and if tomorrow comes, love again." -- Max Lucado

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "One day spent with someone you love can change everything." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Life is a series of pulls back and forth. You want to do one thing, but you are bound to do somehing else. Something hurts you, yet you know it shouldn't. You take certain things for granted, even when you know you should never take anything for granted." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "That's the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "They were things for which it was impossible to prepare but which one spent a lifetime looking back at, trying to accept, interpret, comprehend. Things that should never have happened, that seemed out of place and wrong, these were what prevailed, what endured, in the end." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "Try to remember it always," he said once Gogol had reached him, leading him slowly back across the breakwater, to where his mother and Sonia stood waiting. "Remember that you and I made this journey together to a place where there was nowhere left to go." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Caecilia add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "While the astronauts, heroes forever, spent mere hours on the moon, I have remained in this new world for nearly thirty years. I know that my achievement is quite ordinary. I am not the only man to seek his fortune far from home, and certainly I am not the first. Still, there are times I am bewildered by each mile I have traveled, each meal I have eaten, each person I have known, each room in which I have slept. As ordinary as it all appears, there are times when it is beyond my imagination." (from "The Third and Final Continent")" -- Jhumpa Lahiri
